alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:27PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Mecklenburg and southwestern Lunenburg Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 827 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Redoak to near Staunton River State Park to near Buffalo Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Clarksville around 845 PM EDT. Chase City around 900 PM EDT. Kells Corner around 910 PM EDT. Boydton and Rehoboth around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Fairview, Rogers Corner, Spanish Grove, Loves Mill, Buffalo Junction, Finchley, John H Kerr Reservoir, Finneywood, Skipwith and Wightman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central Virginia.
